intro: Chamaesyce cowellii, commonly known as Cowell's sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with hairy, succulent stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom during the spring and early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Chamaesyce cowellii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
